message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms, including fever, chest pain with deep breathing, and weight loss, suggest tuberculosis. The x-ray findings of a subpleural nodule in the right lower lobe with right hilar lymphadenopathy also support this diagnosis. The histological examination of a right hilar lymph node biopsy specimen showing granulomas with acellular cores further confirms the diagnosis of primary tuberculosis. The other options may have different characteristic findings on biopsy specimens and/or imaging studies.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient's symptoms, including fever, weight loss, chest pain, and lymphadenopathy, suggest tuberculosis. The histological examination of the lymph node biopsy showing granulomas with acellular cores is consistent with primary tuberculosis. Hodgkin lymphoma and pulmonary sarcoidosis can have similar symptoms but typically do not present with granulomas. Miliary tuberculosis involves widespread dissemination of Mycobacterium tuberculosis and would likely result in multiple nodules visible on chest X-ray, rather than a single subpleural nodule.
